results:
Based on the search results, I found information about Polish translations of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World." Here's what the search revealed:

The first Polish translation was done by Stanisława Kuszelewska and published by Rój in 1933. There was also a 1935 edition translated by Stanisława Kuszelewska and published by Rój, and another edition by Kuszelewska published by Oficyna Liberałów in 1985.

Regarding Bogdan Baran's translation, it was published in 1988 by Wydawnictwo Literackie in Kraków. This translation by Bogdan Baran was indeed published by Wydawnictwo Literackie.

The search results indicate that these translations by Stanisława Kuszelewska and Bogdan Baran have been subjects of academic analysis and criticism, particularly in the context of retranslation studies. Academic papers have analyzed selected aspects of the retranslations of Huxley's "Brave New World" in Poland.

The Polish title for "Brave New World" appears as "Nowy wspaniały świat" in various editions.
